statements: UPDATE Payroll_Taxes SET federal_tax = 0.1 WHERE employee_id = 101;
UPDATE Payroll_Taxes SET state_tax = 0.05, salary = 80000 WHERE employee_id = 102;
UPDATE Payroll_Taxes SET federal_tax = 0.15 * salary, state_tax = 0.05 * salary WHERE employee_id = 123;
UPDATE Payroll_Taxes SET state_tax = 2000, federal_tax = 0.2 * salary WHERE employee_id = 456;
UPDATE payroll_employee SET salary = 60000, tax_rate = 0.25 WHERE employee_id = 123;
UPDATE payroll_tax SET tax_rate = 0.1, tax_category = 'Income' WHERE tax_id = 456;
UPDATE payroll_employee SET salary = 50000.00, tax_rate = 0.20 WHERE employee_id = 101;
UPDATE payroll_tax SET tax_rate = 0.18, tax_category = 'Income Tax' WHERE tax_id = 201;
UPDATE employees SET employee_salary = 50000 WHERE employee_id = 101;
UPDATE payroll_info SET net_salary = 40000, gross_salary = 45000 WHERE payroll_id = 201;
UPDATE employees SET employee_salary = 60000.00 WHERE employee_id = 101;
UPDATE payroll_info SET net_salary = 51000.00, gross_salary = 65000.00 WHERE employee_id = 101;
UPDATE employees SET salary = 70000, tax_rate = 20.00 WHERE employee_name = 'John Doe';
UPDATE tax_brackets SET tax_rate = 25.50, bracket_max = 50000.00 WHERE bracket_id = 1;
UPDATE employees SET salary = 60000, tax_rate = 22.50 WHERE employee_id = 101;
UPDATE tax_brackets SET bracket_max = 80000, tax_rate = 25.00 WHERE bracket_id = 2;
UPDATE Employee SET salary = 50000 WHERE employee_id = 1;
UPDATE Payroll SET net_pay = 4500.50 WHERE payroll_id = 100;
UPDATE Employee SET salary = 60000.00, tax_rate = 0.25 WHERE employee_id = 101;
UPDATE Payroll SET net_pay = 4500.00, payment_date = '2022-08-15' WHERE employee_id = 201;
